segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Accounts Guest account status security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Accounts Guest account status security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Accounts: Guest account status security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Accounts: Guest account status security policy setting.

segment.source: The Accounts: Guest account status policy setting determines whether the Guest account is enabled or disabled.
segment.target: The Accounts: Guest account status policy setting determines whether the Guest account is enabled or disabled.

segment.source: This account allows unauthenticated network users to gain access to the system by logging on as a Guest with no password.
segment.target: This account allows unauthenticated network users to gain access to the system by logging on as a Guest with no password.

segment.source: Unauthorized users can access any resources that are accessible to the Guest account over the network.
segment.target: Unauthorized users can access any resources that are accessible to the Guest account over the network.

segment.source: This means that any network shared folders with permissions that allow access to the Guest account, the Guests group, or the Everyone group will be accessible over the network.
segment.target: This means that any network shared folders with permissions that allow access to the Guest account, the Guests group, or the Everyone group will be accessible over the network.

segment.source: This can lead to the exposure or corruption of data.
segment.target: This can lead to the exposure or corruption of data.

segment.source: Set Accounts: Guest account status to Disabled so that the built-in Guest account is no longer usable.
segment.target: Set Accounts: Guest account status to Disabled so that the built-in Guest account is no longer usable.

segment.source: All network users will have to authenticate before they can access shared resources on the system.
segment.target: All network users will have to authenticate before they can access shared resources on the system.

segment.source: If the Guest account is disabled and Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts is set to Guest only, network logons—such as those performed by the SMB Service—will fail.
segment.target: If the Guest account is disabled and Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts is set to Guest only, network logons—such as those performed by the SMB Service—will fail.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: The default Guest account allows unauthenticated network users to log on as a Guest with no password.
segment.target: The default Guest account allows unauthenticated network users to log on as a Guest with no password.

segment.source: These unauthorized users could access any resources that are accessible to the Guest account over the network.
segment.target: These unauthorized users could access any resources that are accessible to the Guest account over the network.

segment.source: This capability means that any shared folders with permissions that allow access to the Guest account, the Guests group, or the Everyone group are accessible over the network, which could lead to the exposure or corruption of data.
segment.target: This capability means that any shared folders with permissions that allow access to the Guest account, the Guests group, or the Everyone group are accessible over the network, which could lead to the exposure or corruption of data.

segment.source: Disable the Accounts: Guest account status setting so that the built-in Guest account cannot be used.
segment.target: Disable the Accounts: Guest account status setting so that the built-in Guest account cannot be used.

segment.source: All network users must be authenticated before they can access shared resources.
segment.target: All network users must be authenticated before they can access shared resources.

segment.source: If you disable the Guest account and the Network Access: Sharing and Security Model option is set to Guest Only, network logons, such as those performed by the Microsoft Network Server (SMB Service), fail.
segment.target: If you disable the Guest account and the Network Access: Sharing and Security Model option is set to Guest Only, network logons, such as those performed by the Microsoft Network Server (SMB Service), fail.

segment.source: This policy setting should have little impact on most organizations because it is the default setting starting with Windows Vista and Windows Server 2003.
segment.target: This policy setting should have little impact on most organizations because it is the default setting starting with Windows Vista and Windows Server 2003.
